What does `OPTION_NFT_TOKEN` do when set in a Verus currency definition?
When `OPTION_NFT_TOKEN` is set to 2048 in a Verus currency definition, it creates a single satoshi NFT token, which tokenizes control over the root ID.

// if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
What does `OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER` do when set in a Verus currency definition?
When `OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER` is set to 512 in a Verus currency definition, it means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices.

// if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
What does `OPTION_PBAAS` do when set in a Verus currency definition?
When `OPTION_PBAAS` is set to 256 in a Verus currency definition, it indicates that this is a PBaaS (Public Blockchain as a Service) chain definition.

// if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
What does `OPTION_GATEWAY` do when set in a Verus currency definition?
When `OPTION_GATEWAY` is set to 128 in a Verus currency definition, it means that this currency routes external currencies.

// if set, this is a token, not a native currency OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID ```
